Generation V.Black: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.
Generation V.White: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
Generation V.Black 2: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
Generation V.White 2: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.

Generation VI.X: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
Generation VI.Y: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: A clean freak that will not allow even the slightest mess, it uses its tail like a mop to thoroughly clean any and all filth.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.

Generation VIII.Sword: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
Generation VIII.Shield: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.

Generation IX.Scarlet: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean springwater.
Generation IX.Violet: These Pokémon like things neat and tidy. They are always sweeping and dusting their habitat, using their tails as brooms.

Generation VIII.Sword: Route 5 , Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell , Giant's Cap Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Route 5 , Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell , Giant's Cap Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
